result.execSummary:
The defendant Darlene A. Nagorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs 
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Submit DNA sample if not done so
*Not to have contact with Copps in Stevens Point during 12 month period of probation
*Commit no other crimes during period of probation

timeConds.notes:
*Report to jail today 
*Sentence to commence within 60 days
*Huber granted for purposes of providing child care to granddaughter and providing medical and nursing care to husband during length of supervision

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darlene A. Nagorski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darlene A. Nagorski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:58 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court has been handed the  Plea questionnaire/Agreement.

Atty Knaapen states plea agreement.
Defendant will be pleading to charge set forth in complaint.
State files restitution statement.
Defense is free to argue. 

Atty Halverson concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found GUILTY

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends jail sentence.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends further probation.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 6 Months, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 40 Days
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Huber granted for purposes of providing child care to granddaughter and providing medical and nursing care to husband during length of supervision
Submit DNA Sample if not done so
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay court costs
Pay Restitution of $72.81 in favor of Copps
Not to have contact with Copps Store in Stevens Point during 12 month period of probation
Commit no other crimes during period of probation

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darlene A. Nagorski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
$1,000 sig bond: No contact with the Copps in Stevens Point.

FTR: 1:29:00
DA #15PT1783
d.o.b. 08-29-1946
  ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft, Criminal Trespass.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 sig bond:  with conditions as stated.
BTC: $1,000 sig bond: No contact with the Copps in Stevens Point.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 10-05-15   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
